ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Now I would like to ask you about terrible, frightening, or horrible experiences you may have had at any time in your life. Have you ever been in military combat?
During your time in combat, were you ever held captive or tortured?
IF YES: How old were you (when you were held captive or tortured)?
Notes: IF MULTIPLE EXPERIENCES OF ANY EVENT, CODE AGE OF FIRST EXPERIENCE.

ElementDescription: During your time in combat, were you ever wounded?
IF YES: How old were you (when you were wounded in combat)?
Notes: IF MULTIPLE EXPERIENCES OF ANY EVENT, CODE AGE OF FIRST EXPERIENCE

ElementDescription: During your time in combat, did you ever see someone seriously injured or killed?
IF YES: How old were you (when you saw someone seriously injured or killed)?
Notes: IF MULTIPLE EXPERIENCES OF ANY EVENT, CODE AGE OF FIRST EXPERIENCE

ElementDescription: During your time in combat, did you ever discover a dead body?
IF YES: How old were you (when you discovered a dead body)?
Notes: IF MULTIPLE EXPERIENCES OF ANY EVENT, CODE AGE OF FIRST EXPERIENCE

ElementDescription: During your time in combat, did you have any other experiences that were terrible, frightening, or horrible?
Notes: 1=NO (SKIP TO A5); 5=Yes; 999=Missing; IF EVENT FITS IN ANY CATEGORY IN A1-A4, GO BACK AND CODE THERE.

ElementDescription: The next questions are for situations and events not related to military combat.  Have you ever been shot?
IF YES: How old were you (when you were shot?)
Have you ever been stabbed?
IF YES: How old were you (when you were stabbed)?
Notes: IF MULTIPLE EXPERIENCES OF ANY EVENT, CODE AGE OF FIRST EXPERIENCE

ElementDescription: Have you ever been mugged or threatened with a weapon, or experienced a break-in or robbery?
IF YES: How old were you (when you were mugged/threatened with a weapon/experienced a break-in or robbery)?
Notes: IF MULTIPLE EXPERIENCES OF ANY EVENT, CODE AGE OF FIRST EXPERIENCE

ElementDescription: Have you ever been raped or sexually assaulted by someone?
IF YES: How old were you when (you were raped or sexually assaulted)?
Have you ever been in a natural disaster like a fire, flood, earthquake, tornado, mudslide or hurricane?
IF YES: How old were you (when you were in this natural disaster)?
Have you ever learned you had been exposed to radiation, dioxin, or any other dangerous materials?
Notes: Have you ever been in a natural disaster like a fire, flood, earthquake, tornado, mudslide or hurricane?

ElementDescription: IF YES, have you ever been in a natural disaster like a fire, flood, earthquake, tornado, mudslide or hurricane? How old were you?
Have you ever learned you had been exposed to radiation, dioxin, or any other dangerous materials?
IF YES: How old were you (when you experienced this sudden death)?
Notes: If YES, have you ever learned you had been exposed to radiation, dioxin, or any other dangerous materials? How old were you?

ElementDescription: Have you ever been held captive, tortured, or kidnapped?
IF YES: How old were you (when you were held captive/tortured/kidnapped)?
Have you ever been diagnosed with a life-threatening illness?
IF YES: How old were you when (you were diagnosed with this illness)?
Have you ever been in a serious accident?
IF YES: How old were you (when this accident happened)?
Have you ever seen someone being seriously injured or killed?
IF YES: How old were you when (when you saw someone being seriously injured or killed)?
Have you ever unexpectedly discovered a dead body?
IF YES: How old were you (when you unexpectedly discovered this dead body)?
Have you ever learned that any of these terrible things had happened to a close friend or relative when you were not there?
IF YES: How old were you (when you learned that one these terrible things had happened to a close friend or relative when you were not there)?
Have you ever had any other experiences that were terrible, frightening, or horrible?
Notes: 1=NO (SKIP TO BOX PT1); 5=YES; 999=Missing; IF ONLY BOOK, MOVIE, OR TV PROGRAMS CODE 1;  IF EVENT FITS IN ANY OF THE CATEGORIES IN A5-A18, GO BACK AND CODE THERE

ElementDescription: After a very frightening or horrible experience, some people can't get it out of their minds. They may lose interest in people or activities; they may not sleep well; and they may become very jumpy and easily startled or frightened. Did (this/any of these) experience(s) have that effect on you that lasted one month or longer?
Which one caused the most problems?
Notes: 999=Missing; EVENT # REVIEW EXPERIENCES CODED 5 IN PT1A.1 - 20.

ElementDescription: After (EVENT), did you keep thinking about it over and over when you didn't want to?
Did you keep having bad dreams or nightmares about it?
Did you ever suddenly feel as though you were experiencing it all over again?
Did being reminded of it or being in a similar situation make you very upset or anxious?
Did you notice that your heart would pound, you would sweat, or become physically ill when you were reminded of it?
Did the period when you were having these reactions to the (EVENT) last for a month or longer?
In the last 12 months, has there been a month or longer when you had some of those problems because of (EVENT)?
After (EVENT), did you try to avoid thinking or talking about it?
Did you stay away from certain places, people, or activities to avoid being reminded of it?
Did you have amnesia for it - that is, forget all or part of it?
Was this because you were injured or unconscious?
After (EVENT), did you lose interest in activities that were once important or enjoyable?
Did you begin to feel more isolated or distant from other people?
After it, did you find it more difficult to have love or affection for other people?
Did you begin to feel that there was no point in planning for the future?
Was there a month or longer when you would have these feelings or behaviors because of (EVENT)?
Notes: 1= NO (SKIP TO PT17); 5=YES; 999=Missing; REVIEW SX CODED 5 IN PT9-15.

ElementDescription: Was there a month or more in the last 12 months when (EVENT) made you act or feel in those ways?
After this experience was over, were you having more trouble than usual falling asleep or staying asleep?
Did you become more irritable or short-tempered?
Were you having more trouble than usual keeping your mind on what you were doing?
After it, did your concern about danger increase, and did you become much more careful than before?
Did you become jumpy or get easily startled by ordinary noises or movements?
After (EVENT), did you have a period of more than a month when you?
In the last 12 months, has there been a month or more when you had some of these problems because (EVENT)?
Did you tell a doctor about the feelings or behaviors you were having after (EVENT)?
Did you tell any other health professional about these feelings or behaviors?
Notes: 1=NO; 5=YES (SKIP TO D); 999=Missing; (SX CODED 5 IN PT3 - PT21)

ElementDescription: Were these feelings or behaviors ever the result of physical illness or injury?
Were these feelings or behaviors ever the result of medication, drugs, or alcohol?
Notes: 1= NO (SKIP TO A3); 5=YES (SKIP TO J); 999=Missing; (SX CODED 5 IN PT3-21)

ElementDescription: When you told the (doctor/health professional), what was the diagnosis? (What did the doctor/health professional say was causing these feelings or behaviors?)
Notes: 1 = STRESS, PSYCH (SKIP TO PT24); 2 = MEDS, A/D (SKIP TO J); 3 = ILLNESS/INJ (SKIP TO H); 4=NO DX, DK (SKIP TO G); 999=Missing; (SX CODED 5 IN PT3-21)

ElementDescription: Did the (doctor/health professional) find anything abnormal by an exam, test, or x-ray?
Were these feelings or behaviors always the result of physical illness or injury?
When the feelings or behaviors were not due to physical illness or injury, were these feelings or behaviors always the result of medication, drugs, or alcohol?
Were these feelings or behaviors always the result of medication, drugs, or alcohol?
When these feelings or behaviors were not due to medication, drugs, or alcohol, were they always the result of physical illness or injury?
Notes: 1=NO (SKIP TO PT24); 5=YES (SKIP TO OC1); 999=Missing; (SX CODED 5 IN PT3-21)

ElementDescription: Did these feelings or behaviors interfere with your life or activities a lot?
Did the feelings or behavior caused by (EVENT) result in difficulties for you with family, friends, or work at any time in the last 12 months?
Did the feelings or behavior caused by (EVENT) ever result in difficulties for you with family, friends,or work?
Did the feelings or behavior caused by (EVENT) ever result in serious difficulties for you with family, friends, or work for a month or longer?
How soon after (EVENT - REVIEW SX CODED 5 IN PT3-PT21) did you first have one of the problems we talked about? NUMBER ONLY (CODE UNIT in pt25_unit)?
How long did these reactions to (EVENT) last? NUMBER ONLY (CODE UNIT in pt25_unit)?
How old were you the last time you had any of these problems as a result of (EVENT)?
Notes: AGE RECENCY (whole years): IF AGE ONSET WITHIN 2 YEARS OF AGE RECENCY SKIP TO PT28.

ElementDescription: Between the time you were (AGE ONSET OF EVENT) when (EVENT) and (AGE REC) when you last had problems because of it, was there at least a full year when (EVENT) did not cause you any of these problems?

IF YES: Between what ages did (EVENT) not cause you any of these problems at all? To age... ?
IF YES: Between what ages did (EVENT) not cause you any of these problems at all? Any other years?
IF YES: Between what ages did (EVENT) not cause you any of these problems at all? Any other years? From age?
IF YES: Between what ages did (EVENT) not cause you any of these problems at all? Any other years? To age?
Did respondent mention more than 2 remissions?
Was there any time in the last year when you wanted to talk to a doctor or health professional about any of the feelings or behaviors caused by (EVENT)?
Was there any time in the last year when you wanted to talk to a doctor or health professional about any of the feelings or behaviors caused by (EVENT)? IF YES, Did you do it?
